title: How much does Tom Brady’s lack of support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX bother you?
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady, Raiders minority owner, did not explicitly support the Patriots in Super Bowl LX.
Brady expressed neutrality about the Patriots-Seahawks matchup, emphasizing support for individuals like Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels.
Former Patriots like Vince Wilfork expressed frustration over Brady's lack of team allegiance in the Super Bowl.

title: Hingham kids revive a lucky tradition on Patriots Way ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hingham kids revive the Patriots Way photo tradition ahead of Super Bowl LX to support New England Patriots.
The tradition began in 2017 when Hingham residents gathered kids for a group photo under the Patriots Way sign.
The Patriots Way photo is considered a good luck charm by the neighborhood, with the Patriots winning after the photo's initial debut.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 5, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Nohri offers Nikkei cuisine blending Japanese technique with Peruvian ingredients, featuring handrolls and ceviches in Chinatown.
Novo Lantern replaces Nan Xiang Express in the South End, serving handmade dumplings and wok-fried dishes.
Retro Room, a listening lounge with comfort food and craft cocktails, debuts in Back Bay Social's basement.

title: Super Bowl betting expected to surge as experts warn of problem gambling
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: American Gaming Association projects $1.76 billion in Super Bowl LX bets, a 27% increase from previous year.
Massachusetts reported $19.6 million in tax revenue from $98.47 million in taxable sports betting in December 2025.
Problem gambling rates among Massachusetts monthly gamblers increased from 20.9% in 2022 to 28% in Fall 2024.

title: Boston police release Super Bowl safety plan, limiting traffic, parking, pedestrian access
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston police will enforce traffic, parking, and pedestrian restrictions near campuses and nightlife areas for Super Bowl LX.
Temporary restrictions will affect areas around Boston University, Northeastern University, Brighton, Kenmore Square, Faneuil Hall, and North Station.
Police urge caution due to extreme cold and increase patrols around bars; underage drinking and disruptive behavior will face consequences.

title: As storm cleanup lingers, City Council pushes for snow melters and dedicated ‘snow corps’
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council proposes volunteer 'snow corps' and snow melters to improve snow removal after major storms.
Councilor Ed Flynn cited resources issues at City Hall, while Councilor Enrique Pepén suggested volunteer programs for shoveling.
State Senator Nick Collins urged state officials to aid Boston's snow removal, bypassing Mayor Michelle Wu's administration.

title: Not Drake Maye — just his Raynham, Mass., lookalike
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Tyler Dumas, a Massasoit Community College student, gained local fame for resembling New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye.
A viral TikTok from Ryan Family Amusements highlighted Dumas's likeness to Maye, boosting his local celebrity status.
Dumas, an avid Patriots fan, expressed hope to meet Drake Maye and play catch with him in the future.

title: David Pastrnak will be a flag-bearer for Czechia at Winter Olympics opening ceremony
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: David Pastrnak will be a flag-bearer for Czechia at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony.
Czechia will face Canada in its first preliminary round match on February 12 at the Winter Olympics.
Edmonton Oilers' Leon Draisaitl will also serve as a flag-bearer, representing Germany at the opening ceremony.

title: Where were the 2025 Patriots back in 2015? We collected stories from the locker room and podium
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: In 2015, Patriots players were mostly teenagers, with some navigating college recruitments, such as Carlton Davis signing with Auburn.
Linebacker Robert Spillane, undrafted out of college, reflects on continually striving for improvement in his NFL career.
Harold Landry, leading in sacks for Patriots, met his wife while training at Boston College after his sophomore year.

title: After 25 years, MetroWest Jewish Day School will shut its doors
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: MetroWest Jewish Day School in Framingham to close at the end of this school year after 25 years.
The school cites unsustainable costs of its personalized Jewish education model as the reason for closure.
The Finn family pledges tuition support for continuing education; final gala planned in April to honor the school's legacy.
